hanzi-su-wiki:
師

Значения

Наставник, учитель; образцовый, мастерский; военный; суффикс лица по профессии

Мнемоника

Военное училище, ср. похожий знак 帥. Верхняя черта означает первое, т.е. лучшее из таких заведений, а также тех, кто там преподает — учителей, наставников.

Варианты

师

heisig_chinese_memo: A maestro in a large auditorium with high ceilings is conducting his orchestra of expert musicians like a passionate teacher at a fever-pitch, sweat pouring out of him. When the piece is over he reaches for his towel to wipe his brow.
heisig_constituent: expert, maestro, noren, one, ceiling, towel
Keyword_KANJIDIC: expert, teacher, master, model, exemplar, army (incl. counter), war
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: эксперт, преподаватель, мастер, модель, образец, армия (вкл. счетчик), война
koohiiStory1: A maestro in a large auditorium with high ceilings is conducting his orchestra of expert musicians at a fever-pitch, sweat pouring out of him. When the piece is over he reaches for his towel to wipe his brow.
koohiiStory2: Maestro is such as expert, he can conduct even with a towel hanging from the ceiling in front of him.
jp_example_words:
牧師(ぼくし): pastor, minister, clergyman
医師(いし): doctor
技師(ぎし): engineer, technician
教師(きょうし): classroom teacher
講師(こうし): lecturer
漁師(りょうし): fisherman
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A drop of water falls from a bear onto the ground and needs to be wiped up with a towel. Only a teacher or an expert could get away with getting close to this wet bear to wipe up after it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: The expert is also your teacher, and she's showing you how to clean up after this bear.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The teacher tells you to start with something smaller, after all, you're not an expert yet. You have to practice on a wet sheep (し). "I became a wet, dangerous animal expert by starting with sheep, you will too!" your teacher says.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Your teacher assures you this wet sheep is far less dangerous to clean up after than a wet bear. They're the expert, so you should listen and wipe up after that sheep.
Ru_Meaning: expert, teacher, master, model, exemplar, army (incl. counter), war
Ru_Notes:
Не путать: 帥 (スイ верховное командование).
Kanjidic приводит чтение いくさ ("армия", древняя единица деления в китайских войсках) — но оно в наше время не используется.
Ru_trainchinese: shī: (сущ/глаг) учитель, наставник; пример, образец; специалист в определенной отрасли; (о буддийском монахе) мастер; учиться у, подражать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the two mouths (𠂤) with the one turban (帀) become teachers
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A teacher is like a commander inside under a ceiling.
origin_of_ch_char_book: Army commanders have to check many things constantly, such as weapons, supplies, food, and the morale. (師, 师, shi=shih, teacher) shows a small hill and the action of walking around the hill repeatedly (還, 还, huan;hai, return; still).
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The word for division is from " 𠂤 " from "帀", " 𠂤 " is the ancient word for " teacher ", and the font is interpreted as Xiao Tufu (Sun Haibo), and also interpreted as "Hip 尻" (Kato Changxian). " Za " ancient " In the final analysis ," the word, like a foundation, a " division " of sound character (Zhang Shi-chao). Because the army stationed mostly in Tufu to defend, " 𠂤 " was later translated as " division ".

The meaning of the oracle bone inscriptions is unknown, but the inscriptions on the inscriptions on the oracle bones indicate the name of the official position. They are the military chiefs who are also in charge of administration and education. They are also called "Shishi". Represents the division, brigade, and army. Zhongshan Wang Yuanhu: "Wei (rate) Shi Zhengli (yan)"; also used as a name.

Bones, mostly inscriptions " 𠂤 " means the military, and many more inscriptions " division " means that the division's Officials, after the late Western Zhou bronze inscriptions mostly " Za " means "work Za" Officials this, " 𠂤 " , "帀" will be written as " teacher " in later generations. The three characters can be read through. Scholars may think that " 𠂤 " and "帀" are the provincial language of " teacher " (Dai Jiaxiang).

" Teacher " is pronounced " Rhinoceros " in Han, and the second chapter of the bronze mirror inscription of the poem " Suoren " in Han Dynasty: "The tooth is like a teacher", "Poem. "Suoren" is made "tooth like a rhinoceros".

"Said Wen": "Two thousand five hundred people are the teachers. From the 帀 to the 𠂤. 𠂤, the four 帀, all the ideas are also. 𠦵, the ancient literary teacher." Duan Yucai's note: "Little Situ said: Five people are the team, five Five are two, five are pawns, and five pawns are brigade. The five brigades are teachers. Teachers are all. The capital is called by the general public. Everyone must be the master. Zhou Li Shishi's note: Teacher, teach people to do It’s also called the person.”
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The word " 𠂤 " is from "帀", " 𠂤 " is Xiao Tufu, and "帀" is sound symbol. Because the army is stationed in Tufu, the original meaning is the army.
humanum_full_description:
師字從「𠂤」從「帀」，「𠂤」是古「師」字，字形有解作小土阜(孫海波)，亦有解作「臀尻」(加藤常賢)。「帀」是古「柢」字，象根柢，是「師」的聲符(張世超)。由於軍旅駐紮多據土阜以守，故後來「𠂤」遂解作「師」。

　　甲骨文用義不詳，金文多表示職官名，為軍事長官，兼掌行政及教育，又稱「師氏」，仲枏氏鬲：「師湯父有𤔲仲枏父乍寶鬲」；又表示師旅、軍隊，中山王圓壺：「䢦(率)師征郾(燕)」；又用作人名。

　　甲骨、金文多以「𠂤」表示軍旅，金文多以「師」表示師氏這種職官，西周晚期以後金文多以「帀」表示「工帀」這種職官，「𠂤」、「帀」後世皆寫作「師」，三字可以通讀，學者或認為「𠂤」、「帀」是「師」的省文(戴家祥)。

　　「師」漢通讀為「犀」，漢《碩人》詩銅鏡銘二章：「齒如會師」，《詩．碩人》作「齒如瓠犀」。

　　《說文》：「二千五百人爲師。从帀从𠂤。𠂤，四帀，眾意也。𠦵，古文師。」段玉裁注：「小司徒曰：五人爲伍，五伍爲兩，五兩爲卒，五卒爲旅。五旅爲師。師，衆也。京師者，大衆之稱。衆則必有主之者。周禮師氏注曰：師，敎人以道者之稱也。」
humanum_short_description: 師字從「𠂤」從「帀」，「𠂤」是小土阜，「帀」是聲符。由於軍旅駐紮多據土阜以守，故本義是軍隊。

①教人的人：老師。導師。師傅。師生。師徒。師德。良師益友。好(hào)爲人師。
②擅長某種技術的人：工程師。醫師。技師。
③效法：師法古人。
④榜樣：師範。
⑤指由師徒或師生關係產生的：師母。師兄。師弟。師妹。
⑥對和尚或道士的尊稱：法師。禪師。
⑦軍隊：會師。出師。
⑧軍隊的編制單位，團或旅的上一級：師長。師座。
⑨一國的首都：京師。
⑩姓氏。

師字從「 𠂤 」從「 帀 」，「 𠂤 」是古「 師 」字，字形有解作小土阜(孫海波)，亦有解作「臀尻」(加藤常賢)。「 帀 」是古「 柢 」字，象根柢，是「 師 」的聲符(張世超)。由於軍旅駐紮多據土阜以守，故後來「 𠂤 」遂解作「 師 」。 甲骨文用義不詳，金文多表示職官名，為軍事長官，兼掌行政及教育，又稱「師氏」，仲枏氏鬲：「師湯父有𤔲仲枏父乍寶鬲」；又表示師旅、軍隊，中山王圓壺：「䢦(率)師征郾(燕)」；又用作人名。 甲骨、金文多以「 𠂤 」表示軍旅，金文多以「 師 」表示師氏這種職官，西周晚期以後金文多以「 帀 」表示「工帀」這種職官，「 𠂤 」、「 帀 」後世皆寫作「 師 」，三字可以通讀，學者或認為「 𠂤 」、「 帀 」是「 師 」的省文(戴家祥)。 「 師 」漢通讀為「 犀 」，漢《碩人》詩銅鏡銘二章：「齒如會師」，《詩．碩人》作「齒如瓠犀」。 《說文》：「二千五百人爲師。从帀从𠂤。𠂤，四帀，眾意也。𠦵，古文師。」段玉裁注：「小司徒曰：五人爲伍，五伍爲兩，五兩爲卒，五卒爲旅。五旅爲師。師，衆也。京師者，大衆之稱。衆則必有主之者。周禮師氏注曰：師，敎人以道者之稱也。」

" Za" ancient " In the final analysis," the word, like a foundation, a " division" of sound character (Zhang Shi-chao). Because the army stationed mostly in Tufu to defend, " 𠂤" was later translated as " division". The meaning of the oracle bone inscriptions is unknown, but the inscriptions on the inscriptions on the oracle bones indicate the name of the official position. They are the military chiefs who are also in charge of administration and education. They are also called "Shishi". Represents the division, brigade, and army. 師字的基本解释

師
shī
见“师”。

師字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shī］
［《廣韻》疏夷切，平脂，生。］
“师1”的繁体字。
(1)民众，徒众。
(2)指众多。
(3)古代行政区划单位。
(4)泛指大城市。
(5)古代军队的编制以二千五百人为一师。现代军队的编制单位，隶属于军或集团军，下辖若干旅或团。
(6)军旅，军队。
(7)出兵征伐，进军。
(8)指动武，械斗。
(9)驻扎。
(10)军师，参谋。
(11)长，首领。
(12)以称专司一事的神道或官员。
(13)指乐官，乐师。
(14)指专精某种技艺的人。
(15)今有会计师、工程师等职称。
(16)官名。太师的省称。周代辅佐国君的官员。
(17)官名。太子的属官。
(18)官名。指王府的属官。
(19)老师，先生。
(20)谓以师礼相待。
(21)学习，效法。
(22)顺应。
(23)对僧、尼、道士的尊称。
(24)《易》卦名。六十四卦之一，坎下坤上。
(25)兽名。“獅”的古字。参见“師子”。
(26)通“帥”。

師字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【巾字部】　師； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页331第35
〔古文〕????【唐韻】疏夷切【集韻】【韻會】霜夷切【正韻】申之切，?音獅。【爾雅·釋詁】衆也。【釋言】人也。【郭註】謂人衆也。　又天子所居曰京師。【詩·大雅】惠此京師。【公羊傳·桓九年】京師者，大衆也。　又【說文】二千五百人爲師。【周禮·地官】五旅爲師。【註】二千五百人。【詩·大雅】周王于邁，六師及之。【傳】天子六軍。【疏】春秋之時，雖累萬之衆，皆稱師。詩之六師，謂六軍之師。【易·師卦註】多以軍爲名，次以師爲名，少以旅爲名。師者，舉中之言。　又【玉篇】範也。敎人以道者之稱也。【書·泰誓】作之師。【禮·文王世子】出則有師。師也者，敎之以事而喻諸德者也。　又【玉篇】象他人也。【增韻】法也，效也。【書·臯陶謨】百僚師師。【傳】師師，相師法。　又長也。【書·益稷】州十有二師。【註】師，長也。　又神名。【周禮·春官】以槱燎祀風師雨師。【註】風師，箕也。雨師，畢也。【屈原·離騷】雷師告余以未具。【註】雷師，豐隆也。　又國名。【史記·大宛傳】樓蘭姑師。【註】

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [shī]
["Guang Yun" sparsely cut, flat fat, raw. ]
Traditional characters for "师1".
(1) People, disciples.
(2) Refers to numerous.
(3) Ancient administrative division units.
(4) Refers to big cities in general.
(5) The establishment of the ancient army consisted of two thousand five hundred men as a division. The organization of the modern army is subordinate to the army or group army and has several brigades or regiments under its jurisdiction.
(6) Army, army.
(7) Send troops to conscript and march.
(8) Refers to the use of force and weaponry.
(9) Stationed.
(10) Military division, staff officer.
(11) Long, leader.
(12) A Shinto or official who is called a specialist.
(13) Refers to music officials and musicians.
(14) Refers to a person who specializes in a certain skill.
(15) Now there are professional titles such as accountant and engineer.
(16) Official name. The provincial title of Taishi. Officials of the Zhou Dynasty who assisted the monarch.
(17) Official name. The official of the prince.
(18) Official name. Refers to the subordinate officials of the palace.
(19) Teacher, sir.
(20) Said to treat each other with respect.
(21) Learn and imitate.
(22) Adaptation.
(23) Honorary titles for monks, nuns, and Taoists.
(24) The hexagram name of "Yi". One of the sixty-four hexagrams, Kanxia Kun Shang.
(25) The name of the animal. The ancient word "lion". See "teacher".
(26) Through "handsome".
division

[Biography] The Sixth Army of the Son of Heaven. 【Sparse】During the Spring and Autumn Period, although many people are tired, they are all called teachers. Name meaning

shī
вм. 师
Radicals: 丶, 一, 巾  (drop, ground, towel, bear)
Meaning Mnemonic
A drop of water falls from a bear onto the ground and needs to be wiped up with a towel. Only a teacher or an expert could get away with getting close to this wet bear to wipe up after it.
The expert is also your teacher, and she's showing you how to clean up after this bear.
Reading Mnemonic
The teacher tells you to start with something smaller, after all, you're not an expert yet. You have to practice on a wet sheep (し). "I became a wet, dangerous animal expert by starting with sheep, you will too!" your teacher says.
Your teacher assures you this wet sheep is far less dangerous to clean up after than a wet bear. They're the expert, so you should listen and wipe up after that sheep.
